name: Pole Workshop with Azdah
description:
Looking for a fun way to boost your fitness and confidence? Join us for a 90-minute pole workshop! This class is perfect for everyone, whether you're a complete beginner or looking to build on your skills. Azdah, our incredible instructor will be there to support you every step of the way, helping you learn new moves and have a great time. It’s all about discovering your strength, feminity and expressing yourself in a welcoming environment.  
Date: 2nd February  2025, Sunday 
Time: 3 - 4.30 pm (Please arrive at the studio by 2.45 pm) 
Venue: Azdah, Indiranagar 
Attire: We’d recommend tight clothing that exposes as much skin as possible, because the skin to bar contact is very important. So you can carry a sports bra and cycling shorts or something of the sort! 
*Be sure to bring a water bottle to stay hydrated! 
Contact Saachi (9513334690) for more info

location.name: Azdah

name: Hike with the Sisters, Misters and Monks on Wheels
description:
Ladies! You asked and we've made it happen! Introducing this beginner-friendly trek to one of the most beautiful locations, just a 1 hour drive away from the city. Join us for a surreal hike experience! 
This hike will be led by certified mountaineers from the Monks on Wheels community - thus ensuring safety and security throughout the experience. 
Location: Near Chikkaballapur, Karnataka. 
Altitude: Approximately 2710 feet (826 meters) above sea level. 
Difficulty Level: Easy, suitable for first time trekkers. 
Trek Duration: Usually takes about 2 hours to complete the round trip. 
--- 
Trek Route 
Route: The trek begins from the base of Gudibande village and ascends through rocky paths and small hills. The trail is not very well-marked, so some route finding is required. The climb is gradual with a few steep sections as you approach the fort. 
Gudibande Fort: The trek culminates at the Gudibande Fort, which is perched atop a hill and offers panoramic views of the surrounding plains, hills, and the nearby Nandi Hills range. 
--- 
Key Highlights 
•⁠  ⁠Historical Significance: The fort, built by Byre Gowda of the Tuluva Dynasty in the 17th century, has a rich history and was used by local rulers for defense. The fort has seven levels with interconnecting escape routes which would help soldiers to flee in case of emergency. On the top of the fort is a Shiva temple known as "Sir Rameshwara Temple", established by Sage Vishwamitra and Lord Rama which is believed to be one of the 108 Jyotirlingas. 
•⁠  ⁠Scenic Views: From the top, you get an excellent view of the surrounding landscape, including the rocky hills and vast plains. The fort’s architecture and the remains of watchtowers are also a significant highlight. 
--- 
Things to carry: 
 
 Umbrellas or caps (optional) 
 Carry bags 
 Water bottle 
 Odomos 
 Medicines (if any) 
 Mobile Charger 
 First Aid Kit 
 Extra pair of clothing 
 Sufficient amount of cash 
 Portable chargers 
 Tissues 
 Masks 
 Sanitizers 
 Sunscreen 
 
Attire: 
 
 Trek shoes (any footwear with good grip will do) 
 Full pants (track pants or leggings) 
 A dri-fit tshirt  
 
Inclusions: 
 
 Breakfast (Veg) 
 Snacks  
 Trek to Gudibande Fort 
 Transport to and from Bangalore Club 
 First Aid kit in case of emergencies 
 2 or more certified guides from Monks on Wheels to manage and keep you entertained throughout the event 
 
--- 
This hike is for community members and their friends, so feel free to book spots for some Misters you know too! 
Reach out to Saachi (9513334690) for more details.

name: Dance Party with Jagriti
description:
Looking to enjoy your Sunday while still getting a great workout in? Join us at this 1 hour Dance Party with Jagriti vibing to all the HITS in our cutest fits! 
Date: 23rd Feb 2025, Sunday 
Time: 9-10 am (Please arrive at the studio by 8.45 am) 
Venue: Dhurii Academy of Arts, Domlur 
*Be sure to bring a water bottle to stay hydrated!
